means: <英>（尤指伦敦街头）卖艺人（歌手或奏乐者）

sentence.Network_en: Acrobat, busker . Their feet to the sky, their heads to the floor.
sentence.Network_cn: 耍杂的, 卖艺的, 脚踩天, 头顶地.

sentence.Network_en: NICK EDWARDS : The pair even keep the odd serenading busker amused.
sentence.Network_cn: 尼克爱德华兹: 这两只绵羊让人思索想着美好的回忆.

sentence.Network_en: Outside the church there was a sun - warmed busker who caught our eyes.
sentence.Network_cn: 在教堂外,一个沐浴在阳光下的卖艺人吸引力我们的注意力.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 8多伦多的街头艺术家在地铁里能看到各类街头艺人（Busker）的演出。多伦多的街头艺人可不是那么好当的啊，不但申请手续复杂 …
Busy Hour ... Business to Consumer 商业到个人 Busker 卖艺人 Busy Back 忙回叫.
在西方，街头演奏者（busker）有时会把多种乐器挂在身上，轮流吹奏敲打。这些演奏者就叫做one-man band。

list.abs: I remember when we used to work on the streets as buskers我还记得我们以前在街头当艺人的事
my family and I usually take a walk by the Love River on weekends . we see many kinds of buskers on the way . their shows are all splendid .我和家人假日也常常会去爱河散步，沿途见到许多街头艺人的表演，都非常精采。
criminalisecrime busker 罪恶克星crime happen 案发罪案发生

entry.def: A busker is a person who sings or plays music for money in streets and other public places.

means.word_mean: 1. a person who entertains people for money in public places (as by singing or dancing)

auth_sentence.content: Much like the holiday busker who moves you to actually buy his five-dollar cassette, the thrill, does, sadly, fade on repetition.
auth_sentence.res_content: Much like the holiday busker who moves you to actually buy his five-dollar cassette, the thrill, does, sadly, fade on repetition.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Much like the holiday busker who moves you to actually buy his five-dollar cassette, the thrill, does, sadly, fade on repetition.

auth_sentence.content: Christmas is celebrated on the show with copious amounts of mince pies and carols whistled by blind busker Mark Campbell.
auth_sentence.res_content: Christmas is celebrated on the show with copious amounts of mince pies and carols whistled by blind busker Mark Campbell.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Christmas is celebrated on the show with copious amounts of mince pies and carols whistled by blind busker Mark Campbell.

auth_sentence.content: Let There Be Light seems to take its sad melody from an aged busker's melancholy accordion lament.
auth_sentence.res_content: Let There Be Light seems to take its sad melody from an aged busker's melancholy accordion lament.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let There Be Light seems to take its sad melody from an aged busker's melancholy accordion lament.
